biospec_descr.textblock: The blood samples of all participants were collected at each point of withdrawal.

brief_summary.textblock:
In order to determine whether the 'incubation of craving' phenomenon also occurred in
      alcoholics, investigators employed an experimental approach to investigate the time course
      of cue-induced craving in alcoholism. Eighty male participants were randomly divided into
      Four groups, and they were assessed at 7, 14, 30, and 60 days of abstinence for cue-induced
      alcohol craving . Another group including 19 patients was repeatedly tested for the
      cue-induced alcohol craving at the above abstinence days. Other psychological and
      physiological measures were administered at the four abstinence time points.

clinical_study.brief_title: Incubation of Alcohol Craving During Abstinence

detailed_description.textblock:
All subjects provided written informed consent after a full explanation of the protocol
      design.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  met the criteria of DSM-IV for alcohol dependence

          -  aged 18-60 years,male

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  current or past history of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders,
             Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) axis I disorders

          -  with other serious physical diseases (respiratory disorders, cardiovascular disease
             and so on)

          -  other drug abuse except for nicotine

clinical_study.official_title: The Neural Mechanisms of the Incubation of Cue-induced Craving in Alcohol Dependence

overall_official.affiliation: National Institute on Drug Dependence, China

primary_outcome.measure: changes of alcohol craving measured with visual analogue scales
primary_outcome.time_frame: abstained from alcohol for 7 days, 14 days, 30 days and 60 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: blood pressure changes in different abstinence days
skin conductance changes in different abstinence days

clinical_study.source: National Institute on Drug Dependence, China

collaborator.agency: National Natural Science Foundation of China

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute on Drug Dependence, China

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
